topic.para: System daemons, cron jobs, &systemd; timers, and other applications can generate e-mails and send them to the &rootuser; user of the system. By default, each user account owns a local mailbox and will be notified about new mail messages upon login.

These messages can contain security-relevant reports and incidents that might require a quick response by the system administrator. To get notified about these messages in a timely fashion, it is recommended to forward these mails to a dedicated remote e-mail account that is regularly checked.
